title: old technical manual font
content:
Does anyone know what this is, or if there is something very similar?  
Particularly interested in the rounded ends, and upper case B

Would greatly appreciate the help

Thanks

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017043847im_/http:/typophile.com/files/font_6333.jpg)
author: Ewan

comments.content:
Looks like some made this with a letering stencil, by rotring for instance  
 [http://www.rotring.com/en/produkte/schablonen/schriftschablonen.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017043847/http:/www.rotring.com/en/produkte/schablonen/schriftschablonen.html "http://www.rotring.com/en/produkte/schablonen/schriftschablonen.html")

hi, thanks

but it is printed - its an old manual, and small type, so it looks quite blobby when blown up. can anyone think of a similiar font? we're not looking for the stressed look, but the actual letterforms themselves

actually - your on to something  
the Leroy lettering machine for drafting seems to be close

cheers
i don't know about any leroy, but i'm glad if it helped
